title: Python Doesn't Need a Compiler
shortDescription: Python is interpreted, not compiled - you can run code directly without compilation!
detailedDescription: Unlike languages like C++ or Java that require compilation before execution, Python is an interpreted language. The Python interpreter reads and executes code line by line at runtime. This makes development faster and more interactive, though it can be slower at execution time compared to compiled languages.

# for performance optimization, but you don't manage them
